results.title: The gay men's guide to safer sex (E)
results.creator_credit: David Lewis, James MacKay, Basilisk Productions and Terrence Higgins Trust
results.brief_description: A documentary produced by gay men for gay men offering information on HIV and AIDS and exploring the boundaries and possibilities of safe consensual sex. Using a straightforward presentation sexual information is offered in an unintimidating manner. Includes information on using condoms effectively, how to have safe oral sex and how to avoid transmission of blood and semen in S/M sex play. WARNING: CONTAINS EXPLICIT SEXUAL MATERIAL.
results.title_for_label: The gay men’s guide to safer sex (E)
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lewis, James MacKay, Basilisk Productions and Terrence Higgins Trust

results.title: The Gallant little tailor
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Vivian Milroy, Louis Hagan, Carl Koch and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: A little tailor, plagued by flies kills seven of them at one stroke. Pleased with his exploit, he embroiders on his belt the words ‘Seven at one stroke’. When people read this he is taken for a great hero and sent to fight the giants. By trickery he manages to capture two of the giants and leads them back to the town, where he marries the King’s daughter. Music by Freddie Phillips.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lotte Reiniger, Vivian Milroy, Louis Hagan, Carl Koch and Primrose Productions

results.title: Whales, dolphins and men (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Dolphins and whales share a common ancestor; yet dolphins are the darlings of the public, while whales are the victims of commercial exploitation. The dolphin is considered man’s friend and playmate, the whale continues to be a victim of exploitation and face a very real danger of extinction. Discusses scientific studies of these marine mammals. Note: Some scenes may be offensive to animal lovers.

results.title: A Case of depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the problems of diagnosing depression and treating it. Follows the experience of a suicidal patient through shock therapy and questions the effectiveness of this crude technique. Shows a leucotomy operation which cures a woman of a 9-year depression, but asks how much can be done for the ordinary depressed patient. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.
results.description:

results.title: The Funniest man in the world
results.creator_credit: Vernon P. Becker and Mel May
results.brief_description: A nostalgic look at the life and times of Charlie Chaplin, still considered to be one of the funniest and best slapstick actors in motion picture history. Born in London on 16 April 1889, to parents of music hall fame who were later to divorce, Charlie lived a fairly harsh existence with his mother and older brother Sidney. However Charlie, attracted to the world of stage, finds himself by his early teens winning parts in the stage plays “Jim, a romance of cockney” and “Sherlock Holmes”. It is not long before Chaplin ends up in the United States joining Mack Sennet’s Keystone Films, and the rest, as they say, is history. Narrated by Douglas Fairbanks, Jr this documentary follows Chaplin’s career featuring excerpts from many of his films, including “A Night out”, “The Tramp”, “The Immigrant”, Easy Street” among others and starring such actors as Roscoe “Fatty Arbuckle, Marie Dressler, Douglas Fairbanks, Oliver Hardy, Mary Pickford, Mack Swain and Ben Turpin. The film also includes additional unused new scenes and rare archival newsreel footage of Chaplin in Hollywood with Stan Laurel, Chaplin at 16 and in a UK Music Hall. The “Little Tramp” lives on.
results.description: A nostalgic look at the life and times of Charlie Chaplin, still considered to be one of the funniest and best slapstick actors in motion picture history. Born in London on 16 April 1889, to parents of music hall fame who were later to divorce, Charlie lived a fairly harsh existence with his mother and older brother Sidney. However Charlie, attracted to the world of stage, finds himself by his early teens winning parts in the stage plays “Jim, a romance of cockney” and “Sherlock Holmes”. It is not long before Chaplin ends up in the United States joining Mack Sennet’s Keystone Films, and the rest, as they say, is history. Narrated by Douglas Fairbanks, Jr this documentary follows Chaplin’s career featuring excerpts from many of his films, including “A Night out”, “The Tramp”, “The Immigrant”, Easy Street” among others and starring such actors as Roscoe “Fatty Arbuckle, Marie Dressler, Douglas Fairbanks, Oliver Hardy, Mary Pickford, Mack Swain and Ben Turpin. The film also includes additional unused new scenes and rare archival newsreel footage of Chaplin in Hollywood with Stan Laurel, Chaplin at 16 and in a UK Music Hall. The “Little Tramp” lives on.
description_for_label: A nostalgic look at the life and times of Charlie Chaplin, still considered to be one of the funniest and best slapstick actors in motion picture history. Born in London on 16 April 1889, to parents of music hall fame who were later to divorce, Charlie lived a fairly harsh existence with his mother and older brother Sidney. However Charlie, attracted to the world of stage, finds himself by his early teens winning parts in the stage plays “Jim, a romance of cockney” and “Sherlock Holmes”. It is not long before Chaplin ends up in the United States joining Mack Sennet’s Keystone Films, and the rest, as they say, is history. Narrated by Douglas Fairbanks, Jr this documentary follows Chaplin’s career featuring excerpts from many of his films, including “A Night out”, “The Tramp”, “The Immigrant”, Easy Street” among others and starring such actors as Roscoe “Fatty Arbuckle, Marie Dressler, Douglas Fairbanks, Oliver Hardy, Mary Pickford, Mack Swain and Ben Turpin. The film also includes additional unused new scenes and rare archival newsreel footage of Chaplin in Hollywood with Stan Laurel, Chaplin at 16 and in a UK Music Hall. The “Little Tramp” lives on.

results.title: Tracey and Trevor
results.creator_credit: Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”
Tracey and Trevor discuss how they feel about being a girl and a boy. They reveal their own values and comment on the expectations and prejudices of others, including their friends family and society. The film looks at conflicts faced by children who do not wish to conform to commonly-held sex-role stereotypes.

results.title: The Crab nebula (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Alec Nisbett and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Discusses the research being carried out on the Crab Nebula, and examines the deductions that astronomers are making from the results of their studies.

results.title: 'Screen It' 2012 - winners
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers. In 2012, the theme, ‘Belonging’, attracted around 400 entries.

Nine winning entries were selected across the categories of live action, animation, computer game and a special section, titled “Bullying: no way”. While some films are about fitting in, many of them advocate embracing your unique identity and subsequently being accepted by others.

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2012 Screen It competition!
results.description:

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers. In 2012, the theme, ‘Belonging’, attracted around 400 entries.

Nine winning entries were selected across the categories of live action, animation, computer game and a special section, titled “Bullying: no way”. While some films are about fitting in, many of them advocate embracing your unique identity and subsequently being accepted by others.

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2012 Screen It competition!

results.title: Square pegs
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Today, applying for a job often means submitting to innumerable tests, not only of ability and intelligence, but also of personality. But just how valid are these tests? This program examines some of the techniques used by the boom industry of Management Selection and follows two candidates through their ordeal.

results.title: Honie
results.creator_credit: Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Honie has an Aboriginal mother and an English father and lives in an inner suburb of a large Australian city. The film provides insights into her view of her own identity. An examination of her experiences within school, home and community leads to an awareness of aspects of Aboriginal culture important to Honie and her family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
